PowerPriceComponent.description: A time period in which pricing and power peak identification details are defined. Price components can be overlapping in time to define the full price for one time period.

description.example: A recurring time interval every day with a high power price during day time.

reference.description: Reference to be used to identify this recurring price period in the cost function.

PeakIdentificationSettings.description: Settings that defines how to identify a power peak during a billing period.

peakIdentificationPeriod.description: The time period as an ISO 8601 duration for identifying one single peak to be used in calculations. For example only one peak per day is saved => "P1D".

peakDuration.description: The time length as an ISO 8601 duration for calculating average power to get one peak.

numberOfPeaksForAverageCalculation.description: The number of peaks within a peak pricing period for calculating average peak for that period.

PeakFunction.description: A pseudo code function that describes how to identify a power peak for one power price component. Usage examples at https://someexamples.
